thread.title: PAGASA: Flash floods, landslides possible in Caraga, Davao
thread.title_full: PAGASA: Flash floods, landslides possible in Caraga, Davao

author: Rappler.com
title: PAGASA: Flash floods, landslides possible in Caraga, Davao
text:
#WeatherAlert PAGASA: Flash floods, landslides possible in Caraga, Davao The tail-end of a cold front will bring moderate to heavy rain to the two regions on Wednesday, February 15 Published 11:45 AM, February 15, 2017 Updated 11:45 AM, February 15, 2017 
What's the weather like in your area? Report the situation through Rappler's Agos or tweet us at @rapplerdotcom . Satellite image as of February 15, 10:30 am. Image courtesy of PAGASA 
MANILA, Philippines – State weather bureau PAGASA on Wednesday, February 15, warned residents of the Caraga and Davao regions to be on alert. 
In a bulletin issued 11 am on Wednesday, PAGASA said the tail-end of a cold front is expected to bring moderate to heavy rain to the two regions. 
The rain could trigger flash floods and landslides, according to the state weather bureau. 
Areas in Caraga include Agusan del Norte, Agusan del Sur, Dinagat Islands, Surigao del Norte, and Surigao del Sur. 
Areas in Davao, meanwhile, include Davao del Norte, Davao del Sur, Davao Occidental, Davao Oriental, and Compostela Valley. 
PAGASA also said Eastern Visayas and the rest of Mindanao will have light to moderate rain on Wednesday. – Rappler.com HOW
